metadata.title: CVE-2023-0472 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 109.0.5414.119 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage. (Chromium security severity: High)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0.5481.100-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
